first-time-popup.description: These are days to slow down and reconnect. With yourself, with others, with what matters. <0>These moments remind you why you're doing this.</0>

day-3.title:
Day 3
 Say Thank You
day-3.description: <0>Gratitude lights up the same reward centers in your brain that alcohol used to hit.</0> The difference? This feeling is real and it lasts. One genuine thank you can shift your entire day.

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Reach out to one person (text, call,  or face-to-face)
Tell them specifically what you appreciate
Pay attention to how it makes you feel

day-10.title:
Day 10
 No Social Media
day-10.description: <0>Constant scrolling keeps your nervous system on edge and drains your dopamine.</0> Taking a full day off lets your brain actually rest and helps you reconnect with real life.

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Go totally offline from all social platforms for the day
See what you notice about yourself when you're not distracted
Boredom is actually good for your brain

day-15.title:
Day 15
 Day of Awe
day-15.description: Experiencing awe literally <0>shifts your brain out of the patterns that drive</0> cravings. It reminds you there's so much more to feel than what's been keeping you stuck.

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Seek out something that makes you pause (nature, music, art, the sky, water, silence)
Stay with the feeling for a few minutes
You don't need to capture it, just experience it

day-17.title:
Day 17
 Clear the Air in a Relationship
day-17.description: Unresolved tension creates stress that your body holds onto, and that stress can trigger cravings. <0>Addressing what's unsaid, even imperfectly, lightens the load.</0>

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Bring up something that's been sitting heavy (conversation, text, or even just processing it internally)
It doesn't need to end perfectly
Just moving the stuck energy counts

day-23.title:
Day 23
 Volunteer Day
day-23.description: Helping others triggers your brain's natural reward system and <0>boosts feel-good chemicals like oxytocin.</0> Purpose hits different than any drink ever could.

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Give your time or skills to something that matters to you
Doesn't have to be formal, even small acts count
Notice what it feels like to contribute
You can even say something nice to  a stranger
